page.title: 19AGRICULTURE
page.content:
{The study area}is flat and forms part of the Vale of York. The soils are generally fertile - consisting of medium and sandy loams.
The most important crops are spring barley, wheat, sugar beet, winter barley and oilseed rape. A few oats, potatoes and horticultural crops are also grown.
Pigs are the main type of livestock reared, followed by cattle, sheep and poultry.
There are three large farms in the area: Burton Hall Farm, Lund Farm and Thorpe Hall Farm. Although there are also some smallholdings.
